situation:
A machine can be sold now for P15,000, if kept for another year, its salvage value will decline to P13,000. The operating expenses for this year are expected to be P30,000. A new machine is available for P50,000, with expected operating expenses of P18,000 for the first year, increasing by P1000 a year because of deterioration. It is believed that after 5 years new technology would make replacement necessary; the new machines salvage value at that time is estimated to be P20,000. The MARR is 20%. Should the new machine be acquired? And how much is the comparative use value of the old machine?
(A/G, 20%, 5) = 1.6405
